info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 3:27PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of moderate to heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 326 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Rotterdam Junction to near Richmondville and moving east at 55 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Schenectady, Rotterdam, Scotia, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Schoharie, Delanson, Central Bridge, Alplaus, and East Glenville around 330 PM EST. Altamont and Middleburgh around 335 PM EST. Albany, Clifton Park, Cohoes, Colonie, Latham, Guilderland, Berne, and Waterford around 340 PM EST. Troy, Watervliet, Voorheesville, Green Island, Center Brunswick, and Loudonville around 345 PM EST. Menands and Wynantskill around 350 PM EST. Rensselaer, Delmar, Grafton, and Wyantskill around 355 PM EST. West Sand Lake and Feura Bush around 400 PM EST. East Greenbush, Berlin, and Averill Park around 405 PM EST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 22 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 22 and 7, and between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
